issue.title: outlook.office.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://outlook.office.com/mail/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Foutlook.office.com%2Fmail%2F) ### Comment > when trying to load Outlook, the page glitches, flashing the adblocker logo. I try to click on the adblocker sign to disable it, but as I move my curser away the choice to disable the blocker disapears. The page continues to glitch for about 20 seconds until the 500 error code comes up. By this point the adblocker has turned itself off, however the page will not reload until I manually turn it back on then off again. I have had adguard for a few years on a different laptop (Apple) and this has never happened before. I have had this macbook (apple) for a month now and have only just run into the problem. comment.body:
> We will add new non-antiadblock CSS, JS/scriptlets, HTML filtering/$replace-like rules to specific.txt files.

Then why do we need `general_extensions.txt`?

> (for instance, should be in general_extensions.txt or in antiadblock.txt)

Perhaps it should be `allowlist.txt` instead of `general_extensions.txt`. But I don't recall when we add such exceptions in `allowlist.txt`. Seems to be a rare case.

pull_request.title: Changed descriptions of sections
pull_request.body:
**Purpose:** 
We will add new non-antiadblock CSS, JS/scriptlets, HTML filtering/`$replace`-like rules to `specific.txt` files.
Existing rules will be moved to `specific.txt` gradually to prevent file structure disruption and redundant commenting/grouping.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://outlook.office.com/mail/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Foutlook.office.com%2Fmail%2F) ### Comment > when trying to load Outlook, the page glitches, flashing the adblocker logo. I try to click on the adblocker sign to disable it, but as I move my curser away the choice to disable the blocker disapears. The page continues to glitch for about 20 seconds until the 500 error code comes up. By this point the adblocker has turned itself off, however the page will not reload until I manually turn it back on then off again. I have had adguard for a few years on a different laptop (Apple) and this has never happened before. I have had this macbook (apple) for a month now and have only just run into the problem.
